intro: Canavalia napaliensis, commonly known as the Napali morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a vine, climbing or trailing along the ground, and has compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its flowers bloom in the morning, hence its common name, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Canavalia napaliensis is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
